channel.title: Broomhill Community Council
channel.description: Recent content on Broomhill Community Council

item.title: BCC Statement on the Proposed Broomhill RPZ
item.description: Broomhill Community Council sets out headline concerns regarding Glasgow City Council‚Äôs proposed Restricted Parking Zone (RPZ) for the Broomhill area.

item.title: November 2025 Broomhill Community Council meeting
item.description: The November meeting will be held on 12/11 at Broomhill Primary School.

item.title: Have Your Say: Thornwood Roundabout & Cycle Links Consultation
item.description: Please take a few minutes to complete the consultation and attend the drop-in event on 15 November. Your feedback will help ensure safer crossings, better cycle links, and improved access at Thornwood Roundabout‚Äîa key gateway for Broomhill daily journeys.

item.title: RPZ Update: Community Engagement and Timeline
item.description: Glasgow City Council confirms design modifications are nearing completion for the Restricted Parking Zone (RPZ) in Broomhill, with community engagement to include both online feedback and an in-person exhibition.

item.title: Legends Wanted: Volunteer for Glasgow 2026
item.description: Glasgow 2026 is looking for more than 3,000 volunteers to help bring the Games to life. Applications are open now, with special opportunities for residents in Wards 12 and 13.

item.title: Glasgow 2026 Ticket Pre-Sale and ¬£500 Sports Equipment Prize
item.description: Sign up to the Glasgow 2026 pre-sale for early access to tickets and a chance to win ¬£500 of sports equipment for a local school, club or community group.

item.title: October Broomhill Community Council AGM and meeting
item.description: The 2025 AGM will be a meeting where the community council will be re-elected.

item.title: Broomhill & Thornwood Local Place Plan
item.description: The Broomhill & Thornwood Local Place Plan has now been formally accepted by Glasgow City Council.

item.title: Bus Punctuality Improvements for the 4 & 4A
item.description: Following concerns raised at previous Community Council meetings, First Bus has confirmed significant punctuality improvements for services 4 and 4A.

item.title: Spring Into Summer ‚Äì Rescheduled Community Event
item.description: The Spring Into Summer community event has been rescheduled ‚Äì join us for a fun day of activities on Saturday 30 August!

item.title: Ukrainian Family Fun Day in Victoria Park
item.description: Join us in Victoria Park on Sunday 24 August for a Ukrainian Family Fun Day ‚Äî a free event open to everyone!

item.title: Have your say about Air Quality in Glasgow
item.description: This plan aims to engage us - stakeholders and the general public - in meaningful dialogue. It's about understanding the actions proposed by Glasgow City Council to combat air pollution and achieve better air quality across Glasgow. Your opinions are invaluable in this!

item.title: Gully Cleaning Programme Broomhill/Partick West & Drumchapel 04/02-10/03
item.description:
Gully Cleaning Programme Broomhill/Partick West & Drumchapel 04/02-10/03

Please be advised that our Gullying Cleaning Programme is scheduled to take place in Broomhill/ Partick West & Drumchapel neighbourhood which will commence on Sunday 4th February 2024 weather permitting. The programme is due to last until 10th March 2024 and Glasgow City Council gullies within the area are due to be cleaned as part of this.

Do you park a vehicle in the Broomhill/Partick West & Drumchapel Neighbourhoods

We‚Äôll soon be in the area cleaning gullies, but for us to do our best, we need the streets to be clear of vehicles. This means ùóªùóº ùóΩùóÆùóøùó∏ùó∂ùóªùó¥ your vehicle during the work. There will be temporary parking restrictions (TTRO) in your street and surrounding area üöóÔ∏è ‚ùå

item.title: Friends of Naseby Park unveil book lending library
item.description: A new Book Lending Library, crafted by Fred Munro and supported by Stockline Plastics, has been unveiled by the Friends of Naseby Park in Naseby Park. This community initiative invites the public to borrow, donate, and enjoy books in a shared effort to foster a culture of reading and community spirit in Broomhill.
